characterList.description: A man with a trimmed beard, wearing a baseball cap with a lightning bolt logo and a black button-down shirt.
characterList.name: Matt

characterList.description: A bald man wearing an orange polo shirt and white earphones.
characterList.name: James

content_metadata.description: A detailed exploration of Adjuster TV's future directions, focusing on training programs: Adjuster TV Plus and Fast Track to Deployment.

qAndA.answer: The image depicts a gable roof, with two sloping sides meeting at a ridge.
qAndA.question: What type of roof is shown in the image overlay at the end of the video?

qAndA.answer: This statement emphasizes the value of the Fast Track to Deployment program in identifying the most promising candidates for partner IA firms.
qAndA.question: What is the significance of Matt's statement about sorting 'jewels and diamonds out of warm bodies'?

qAndA.answer: The video transitions from a more curious and informative tone to a more passionate and promotional tone in the second half.
qAndA.question: What is the overall mood of the video?

qAndA.answer: The video encourages viewers to sign up for Adjuster TV Plus to access the library of training videos and other resources.
qAndA.question: What is the primary call to action at the end of the video?

qAndA.answer: The overlay of the house image with the website address and the introduction of music signals a shift to a more promotional style.
qAndA.question: What visual cue signals a shift in tone towards the end of the video?

activities.description: Matt talks about the focus shift to training
Matt describes Adjuster TV Plus and Fast Track to Deployment
James asks Matt about the future of Adjuster TV

characterInteraction.description: James acts as the interviewer, guiding the conversation with questions, while Matt provides detailed answers and insights into his programs.

scenes.contextualRelevance: Matt emphasizes being a certified Xactimate trainer, showcasing his expertise and commits to getting adjusters placed quickly.

mood.description: Curious. James' questions contribute to a sense of inquiry about the future of Adjuster TV.

keyMoments.changeDescription: Transition from split-screen to black screen creates a slight sense of anticipation for what's coming next.

narrativeProgression.description: Matt mentions the shift to more training content.
Matt describes Adjuster TV Plus, a subscription platform with various training resources.
Matt highlights Fast Track to Deployment, a program designed to quickly place trained adjusters with IA firms.

scenes.thematicElements: Focus on training, the importance of partnerships with IA firms, commitment to providing valuable resources to adjusters.
scenes.title: Introduction and Focus Shift

videoEditingDetails.description: Split-screen video with Matt on the left and James on the right

activities.description: Matt elaborates on Adjuster TV Plus and Fast Track to Deployment
Matt explains his personal involvement in refining the training program
Matt talks about the future of Adjuster TV, including plans for expansion and further optimization

scenes.contextualRelevance: Matt's analogy of 'the old roof coming off and the new one going on' effectively illustrates how his program can transform adjusters' careers. Sorting 'jewels and diamonds' out of 'warm bodies' highlights the value provided to partner firms.

mood.description: Passionate, Informative. Matt's tone and hand gestures convey his passion for his training programs.

keyMoments.changeDescription: Transition from black screen to close-up shot creates a more intimate and focused visual.
Shift from Matt speaking to a more promotional style with image overlay and music creates a sense of excitement and call to action.

narrativeProgression.description: Matt describes the hands-on nature of the Adjuster TV Plus content.
Matt emphasizes the personal touch and the refinement process involved in his training programs.
Matt reveals his future plans for Adjuster TV, indicating a focus on optimization and feedback.
Matt states they have nine partner firms in the Fast Track program, demonstrating its success.

scenes.thematicElements: Emphasis on comprehensive training, career advancement, personalized support, partnership and trust with IA firms.
scenes.title: Deep Dive into Training Programs

videoEditingDetails.description: Transition from black screen to a close-up shot of Matt
Image overlay of a house with dimensions

climax.description: Transition to promotional style with image overlay and music, urging viewers to sign up for Adjuster TV Plus.

storylines.description: The evolution and future of Adjuster TV, with a focus on training programs Adjuster TV Plus and Fast Track to Deployment.

content_metadata.title: Adjuster TV: Future Directions and Training Programs

trimmingSuggestions.description: Trim the initial repetitive phrases from Matt to create a more impactful start.
Condense this section to eliminate repetitive language and maintain a strong narrative flow.

timecoded_text_to_speech.text: So at this point, okay, so we've made the videos, we've changed into more training now,
okay, which that seems over the past year.
The focus has been a lot more on the training side than anything else for just your TV.
We've gone more from information and training and how to get ahead to just really the hardcore
training of the exactimate, your certified trainer now with the exactimate.
You've got your fast track deployment that seems to be just really taking off well.
So where do you go from here?
What's next?
Are you working on anything else?
You see anything else in the horizon that you might be thinking about jumping into and
tackling or are you going to ride this wave for a while and then figure it out later?
Yeah, great question.
And I will just to kind of put all that together, everything that we've done in the past, we
still do for the most part.
So the free stuff that goes out, a lot of the stuff I talk about in my training, the
Adjust your TV Plus, which is a subscription platform with exactimate level one and two
through, some ability, exactimate mobile, bunch of scoping in the field with the camera
guy following us, a man guy, a man from veteran adjusting school, bunch of scoping videos,
a whole bunch of different perils.
It's a lot of fun to build Adjust your TV Plus and have it be a place where an adjuster
can watch stuff.
You can watch the way the adjusters do it, experience adjusters do it.
We have construction videos in there.
How does a Roof go on and or come off like the old Roof go on, come off and the old
one goes on, right?
All that stuff is in there.
And then fast track deployment is it's half for the adjuster and it's the other half
is for the I firms and really the industry.
So that's the kind of the final piece that I put everything that I know as an adjuster
and everything that worked really, really well for me that I feel tested and that when
I would train adjusters the learning, the mistakes that I made and the things that I learned
when I had other people with me that I was teaching, all that stuff has been refined
into adjuster into fast track deployment, which is it'll be two years old in June or July.
And it's basically a way for me to say, all right, here's this systemized framework
for the whole claims process start to start to finish and then I'm going to test you
on whether that clicked with you or not, right?
And then when I'm satisfied that you've got it, right, this is the best thing I could
come up with, short of like opening an adjuster school, then I'm handing you off to my partner
I firms who have agreed to say, Matt, we trust you, we trust it, you know, that when
you say that this person is ready to go, they're actually ready to go and we'll take it
from there.
We're going to try to fast track them, is why we call it fast track to the front of the
line for deployments where they can send new people, right?
So you get priority onboarding, right, with them.
And so I'm helping them sort out the jewels, the diamonds out of all the warm bodies.
That's really what a fast track to deployment is, is a way for me to help that people.
And it's, you know, it's priced accordingly and it is, there's a lot of support with
it.
It's all self-paced, right?
Fast track, but there is a, there's a weekly live, live stream that we do Q and A. And
I do additional, I've done so many additional trainings in there that I could have like five
more modules to add to fast track, but they're all in this anyway.
So that's really the whole totality of a gesture TV in a nutshell, like kind of how we generate
revenue and what we're doing for the industry.
As far as like what's in the future, I think that we are at the point now where I've got
something that really, really helps the eye firms, I've got something that really, really
helps the adjusters.
And now we're trying to, at this point, we're trying to get feedback.
We're trying to optimize, we're cutting things out, we're that needs to be cut out, we'll
add things in, we're things are outdated or they don't need to be in there anymore.
And continue to add more partner firms, we have nine now in that program.
And really just like for a lack of a better like analogy, just pouring gas on the fire
we've got, right?
So definitely adding in smaller trainings, like we got a level three coming up for exact
to mate, there's going to be, there's more exact to mate mobile, like sort of like hands
on like workflow process stuff versus like the nuts and bolts of exact to mate mobile,
we've already got that in there locked in.
We want to get more stability stuff in there as well.
So it's, but nothing like no new like giant courses or like conferences or you know, anything
else like that.
So what does it actually look like when adjusters with decades of experience between them scope
a hail damaged house on video?
What about how to actually do a claim and exact to mate?
What is the ability and how do you even get started in it?
What if there was one place, one huge and expanding library of property claims, adjusting
videos showing how it's done?
What if there were also complete exact to mate certifications as well as the latest and
most up to date exact mate mobile training?
You know, what if, what if the dream was a reality?

stand right now at adjustretvplus.com.

Ride along.
Get it right.

youtube_description:
👉🏻👉🏻The FASTEST way to get working as an adjuster:  Beginners Guide to a Claims Adjuster Career  https://www.adjustertv.com/start 👈🏻 👈🏻 Learn how to become a property claims adjuster (FREE):   https://www.adjustertv.com/start

Free Macro Starter Pack (with a free 7 day trial of AdjusterTV Plus): https://adjustertv.com/macros

=====================================================

FREE GUIDES

(Most popular!) Road To The Storm Guide: https://adjustertv.com/start

Resources & Gear Guide: https://adjustertv.com/resources

Licensing Guide: https://adjustertv.com/licensing-guide

Complete Claims Checklist: https://adjustertv.com/checklist

Storm Budget & Income Calculator: https://adjustertv.com/spreadsheet


=====================================================

TRAIN WITH MATT:

Fast Track To Deployment Certification: https://adjustertv.com/certify

Xactimate Training: https://adjustertv.com/xactimate-training#certification

Symbiltiy Training: https://adjustertv.com/symbility-training

The Elite Adjuster Method Book & Audio Book: https://adjustertv.com/book



=====================================================


Get your STATE ADJUSTER LICENSE (or DHS) here:  https://www.adjustertv.com/licensing


===========
MORE FREE GUIDES

What is E&O INSURANCE do you need it: 
https://www.cplic.net/adjustertv/

Pacesetter Claims Service:
https://www.adjustertv.com/pacesetter
===========


===========
PARTNERS

The Special Operations of Adjuster Training:  Veteran Adjusting School. 
https://www.adjustertv.com/vas

All licensing and CE in one place:  AdjusterPro.  
https://www.adjustertv.com/adjusterpro

The biggest party and networking event for adjusters:
https://www.adjustertv.com/naca
===========

By independent adjusters FOR independent adjusters


#claimsadjuster #insuranceadjuster #xactimate #symbiity #haildamage #roofing #insurancecareer
youtube_tags: how to become a claims adjuster
